A near-perfect mp game of cat-and-mouse chases and tense stakeouts, dressed up in classic horror tropes. Even after hundreds of hours each round feels like a new test thanks to the variety in maps, killers, skill builds and equipment loadouts, that allow a very personal expression of your playstyle - with both Survivor and Killer modes, this is 2 games in 1 package. Devilishly skillful at the highest level, capable of flipping you between absolute elation and abject despair in the twirl of a hatchet; nothing is as satisfying as a last-gasp escape or a selflessly coordinated hook rescue. 

It's striking just how unique and honestly bizarre the mechanics are, best explained by Keith Stuart: https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-01-27-everything-i-learned-about-game-design-last-year-i-learned-from-dead-by-daylight

Well-maintained and frequently updated competitive multiplayer, despite balance and ranking issues (particularly on the Survivor side, currently being addressed), with weekly dev streams chatting through it all. Highly recommended, dangerously replayable, and often terrifying.

Unbalanced, OP perks, UP perks, bugs, glitches, bad matchmaking.
Fun with friends or alone. 7/10 would play again.

Honestly I have no idea how this game is still fun with all its flaws. Get it while it's on sale.

EDIT: Where do I even start. The current state of the game is just so bad it's not even funny anymore. The best (and my favorite killer) was nerfed to shit and the 1 super OP perk killers NEEDED at the highest levels to even have a chance at winning was nerfed into the ground. As a result no one plays killer anymore constantly resulting in unfair matchups (which was already a problem because your rank gets reset every month, which is WAY too often). At its's current state I cannot reccomend this game to people. The only way to have fun as a killer now is if you were already an experienced killer and just smurf on survivors once every month. And even that can get messy since no one plays killer so you can end up with survivors that are so high ranked you get fucked anyway. Just stay away until this game is fixed, please.

EDIT2: Killer is somewhat fine now, matchmaking is still fucked tho.

EDIT3: Matchmaking has somewhat improved, at least you don't have to wait for half an hour now.

EDIT4: Behaviour did some dumb shit again, DESPITE THE COMMUNITY TELLING THEM THE CHANGES WERE DUMB, WHEN WILL YOU LEARN??????

First Survivor game: 3 disconnects from my teammates since rushing a Huntress standing literally 3 cm from our hooked friend doesnt work and they all quit leaving me and the Killer

be a nice killer, if survivors disconnect let the last guy win
if you are a survivor, use your brain to not make retarded decisions and DONT disconnect from games, seriously

TL:DR Game fun sometimes but also technically bad.

Well after 1000 hours of playtime i can safely say that the game still isn't good, and before you say well why did you spend 1000 hours in it? Well it's a sort of love hate relationship. It can be fun don't get me wrong buuut from a technical standpoint it's quite outdated. It's 2020 and the devs still haven't managed to give you proper graphic settings, they just give you their settings which in my opinion is just a shitty thing to do and also performance wise it's also not really that good, granted i don't have the best PC for it which is my fault for not beeing able to afford a good PC but here's the thing that confuses me. My PC can run Destiny 2, a gorgeous game with stunning graphics 60 FPS (30 when there is alot of action going on) no problem, so why does this piece of trash dip in frames everytime i just breathe the same air as another person near me? Again im willing to take part of the blame here for my not so strong PC but if they don't give me proper ways to get it to work then part of the blame goes to them too. Instead of just pumping out DLC after DLC and maybe reworking a map here and there they *need* to give the core game some proper settings. Phew now that i got that Rant about my System it's time for me to complain about some other stuff but i'll keep it short since yall got places to be. Balance is pretty much a mess since the devs like to listen to the beginners *cough* and survivor mains *cough* rather than the higher ranks *cough* and maybe stop their clear bias towards Survivors *cough*. Maps are pretty good in detail but again mostly balanced towards survivors. The community is just mostly a collection of not so pleasant people that would be better of without a keyboard, however there are some genuine nice people in them which i appreciate. There are microtransactions in form of cosmetics and a battlepass system which allows you to earn some cosmetics through gameplay which is cool ngl but it's mostly just recolors, i can also say that the prices for the cosmetics are WAAAY to high up, 15â‚¬ for the highest tier cosmetics (yes there a different tiers of cosmetics) and 10â‚¬ for the second highest tier. And lastly the Gameplay, why did i save the Gameplay for last? Well um i dunno really that's a bit of an oversight from me. Anyway the gameplay is this as a Survivor go find a gen, work on a gen for 80 seconds, move on to the next gen, if killer comes hide, if killer sees you run away and try to ''loop'' him on certain areas on the map. As killer go around the map, look for survivors, chase survivor, kill survivor (hopefully), repeat. That's it in a nutshell, there's alot more to it like mindgames and certain areas beeing stronger but this Review is already long enough and my name isn't Whitelight so im not gonna make this a 7 Hour Review. Anyway that's it for my Ted Talk, thank you all for coming and goodbye.

I adore this game. However a good deal of the community is pretty toxic.
Playing killer? You'll get people report you for nothing while they rage at you, even if they won.
Playing survivor? You'll get people report you for nothing while they rage at you, even if they won.
So basically just ignore them and avoid the end of game chat.

The game itself is regularly being updated and new content added as DLC. Devs seem responsive to peoples feedback and are always tweaking things which is good.
Definitely worth picking up while it's on sale.
